item.title: The Lure of the Stinging-less Nettle
item.author: helo@forestgarden.wales (Jake Rayson)
item.description: The stinging nettle Urtica dioica is an excellent forest garden plant. Before it flowers*, it makes a fantastic soup, an excellent if strong-tasting spinach replacement, it makes a nice beer, it contains buckets of iron, oodles of nitrogen, it can be used as a nutritious chop ‘n’ drop mulching material or made into a fertiliser tea, it’s the main food for many butterflies and a host of other wildlife, it’s easy to grow.
